attributes.action: Explain the Data (Use and Access) Bill thoroughly to the people of the UK.
attributes.additional_details:
A bill of 262 pages of 14 far-reaching provisions with 8 main parts and 138 sub-parts. What does this bill mean for the people of the United Kingdom concerning data use and access?

The data (property) of the United Kingdom people is theirs, NOT anyone else's. First, talk to the people of the United Kingdom, be honest and transparent, and see if they agree with the proposals for the Data (Use and Access) Bill and the property of said child, woman, and man.
attributes.background:
Let the people of the United Kingdom decide if this bill is as innocent as it is being made out to be.

For people's reading
 https://bills.parliament.uk/publications/56527/documents/5211

departments.name: Department for Culture, Media and Sport

rejection.details:
You can read more about this Bill in a briefing from the House of Lords Library: 

Data (Use and Access) Bill [HL]: HL Bill 40 of 2024–25 - House of Lords Library

https://lordslibrary.parliament.uk/research-briefings/lln-2024-0063/

If you like, you could submit a petition asking the Government to launch a public consultation on the Bill.
